page.title: 03Cornish Language (Mousehole)
page.content: The last person to speak the {Cornish language}was Dolly Pentreath, she died in 1777 at{Mousehole.}She was well known in the Penzance area and especially in{Mousehole.}By 1650 only the people west of Truro spoke Cornish; the last sermon in the {language}was preached at Landewednack which is in the Lizard in the year 1678. Since about 1860 people have been trying to revive the{Cornish}language. How ever much literature was written to try and revive the{language}no one has succeeded yet in doing so. Here are some{Cornish}words and their meanings:- Ragenys-near an island kynyaf-autumn marow-dead Raginnis hill at{Mousehole}is near St.Clements isle.
